item.title: Stabbing With Syringe in Nigeria Raises Concerns of Ebola as Weapon
item.description: The stabbing involved a federal air marshal at the airport in Lagos on Sunday. Initial tests on the substance in the syringe did not detect Ebola.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW POLLACK
item.media:description: Ebola virus particles (green) budding from an infected cell (orange), all magnified 25,000 times.

item.title: Toronto Mayor in Hospital With an Abdominal Tumor
item.description: After more than a year of political turmoil punctuated by his admission of crack cocaine use and drunken escapades, Mayor Rob Ford of Toronto was admitted to a hospital on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: By IAN AUSTEN

item.title: Struggling to Gauge ISIS Threat, Even as U.S. Prepares to Act
item.description: As President Obama prepares to send the United States on what could be a yearslong military campaign, American intelligence agencies have concluded that the group poses no immediate threat to the United States.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MARK MAZZETTI, ERIC SCHMITT and MARK LANDLER
item.media:description: ISIS fighters on parade in Raqqa, Syria. The group has seized wide sections of Syria and Iraq.

item.title: News Analysis: Extending a Legacy of War
item.description: President Obama on Wednesday night may have ensured that he will pass his successor a volatile and incomplete war, just as he inherited one when he took office.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER

item.title: Obama Promises Sustained Effort to Rout Militants
item.description: President Obama, addressing the nation, said he would deploy nearly 500 more military advisers to Iraq, but sought to draw a distinction between the new action and the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER

item.title: Israel, Facing Criticism, to Investigate Possible Military Misconduct in Gaza
item.description: The announcement appeared to be part of an Israeli effort to pre-empt international war crimes inquiries into the 50-day Gaza conflict.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: The aftermath of an airstrike on a beach in Gaza City in July. Four young Palestinian boys, all cousins, were killed.

item.title: Mexico: Discovery of Coca Plants Puzzles Authorities
item.description: The authorities discovered and destroyed more than 1,600 coca plants this week near the Guatemala border, the first such find in Mexico in recent memory.
item.dc:creator: By RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD

item.title: Most Russian Forces Now Out of Ukraine, Kiev Says
item.description: President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine said the withdrawal of Russian forces augmented the chances for a lasting cease-fire in the southeast.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:description: A separatist fighter stood beside a destroyed Ukrainian military vehicle near Donetsk.

item.title: Human Rights Abuses Reported in Junta-Ruled Thailand
item.description: Amnesty International cites at least one report of torture and hundreds having to report to the military, as well as heavy-handed restrictions on political expression.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS FULLER

item.title: World Briefing : Canada: Ford Is Hospitalized With Possible Tumor
item.description: A Toronto hospital said the city’s mayor, Rob Ford, had been admitted after doctors diagnosed a possible tumor.
item.dc:creator: By IAN AUSTEN

item.title: Open Source: Mocking ISIS in Beirut
item.description: In Beirut, the band Al-Rahel Al-Kabir, or the Great Departed, has been performing a satirical hymn to the leader of ISIS to uproarious laughter.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Israeli Officer Charged in Assault
item.description: A border police officer has been charged with assault after he was filmed beating Tariq Abu Khdeir, a Palestinian-American teenager, on the edges of a violent riot in East Jerusalem in July.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: World Briefing | Africa: Gates Foundation Pledges $50 Million to Fight Ebola
item.description: The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation committed $50 million on Wednesday to the fight against Ebola in West Africa, the largest sum it has ever committed to one outbreak.
item.dc:creator: By DONALD G. McNEIL Jr.

item.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Egypt: Wife’s Dancing Offered as Evidence on Activist
item.description: Prosecutors in an activist’s trial presented a home video of his wife belly-dancing as evidence against him on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Lured Back by a Cease-Fire, but Not Feeling at Home Yet
item.description: Many residents of Donetsk who had fled the fighting and returned on word of a cease-fire found a city that felt empty and still at war.
item.dc:creator: By CARLOTTA GALL
item.media:credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times
item.media:description: Residents bought vegetables in central Donetsk, Ukraine. Many who had fled bombardment returned to the city on word of a cease-fire, but most shops and banks were still closed.

item.title: Peru Investigates the Killing of an Environmental Advocate
item.description: The advocate, Edwin Chota, and three other men were killed in a remote part of the Amazon jungle on their way to meet with leaders of another village in the region.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREA ZARATE and WILLIAM NEUMAN

item.title: Saudi Arabia Will Grant U.S. Request for Anti-ISIS Training Program
item.description: Saudi Arabia has agreed to an American request to provide a base to train moderate Syrian opposition fighters, officials said.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

item.title: Saudis Seem Willing to Grant U.S. Request to Host Anti-ISIS Training Program
item.description: Secretary of State John Kerry was expected in the desert kingdom for a strategy session on combating Sunni militants.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry arrived in Baghdad on Wednesday.

item.title: Obama to Liken ISIS Fight to Campaigns in Yemen and Somalia
item.description: President Obama, in addressing the nation, will seek to draw a distinction between the military action he is preparing and the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq that were begun by his predecessors.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER, JONATHAN WEISMAN and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
item.media:description: President Obama spoke with King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia on Wednesday in the Oval Office.

item.title: For Many Iranians, the ‘Evidence’ Is Clear: ISIS Is an American Invention
item.description: The militant group Islamic State in Iraq and Syria is meant to weaken Iran and its allies, many Iranians say.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS ERDBRINK

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Back to School, to New Marching Orders
item.description: School was back in session across China last week, with some unique elements suggestive of how society is changing.
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: Pupils in Hefei, Anhui Province, posed for a back-to-school photo last week, as schools reopened across China.

item.title: Sunnis in Iraq Often See Their Government as the Bigger Threat
item.description: Many Sunnis in Iraq do not support the Sunni militant group ISIS, but that has not stopped the Iraqi government from attacking them anyway.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By KAREEN FAHIM, AZAM AHMED and KIRK SEMPLE
item.media:description: A fighter from the Badr Brigades guarded a checkpoint that had been reclaimed from ISIS militants near the town of Amerli.

item.title: No Winner Yet, but Afghan Presidential Candidate Still Outlines New Government
item.description: Mr. Ghani told supporters about his plans, even as his chief rival in the presidential election, Abdullah Abdullah, insisted that talks aimed at forming a unity government were deadlocked.
item.dc:creator: By ROD NORDLAND

item.title: Rival British Leaders Campaign in Unity Against Independence for Scotland
item.description: Prime Minister David Cameron and the opposition leader, Ed Miliband, combine emotional appeals with hardheaded warnings as the vote approaches.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHEN CASTLE and ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: A No campaign sign in Selkirk, Scotland. Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain said in a Daily Mail article on Wednesday: "Our message to the Scottish people will be simple: 'We want you to stay.' "

item.title: Oscar Pistorius Murder Trial Verdict Is Due
item.description: The judge presiding over the murder trial of Oscar Pistorius, who killed his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp, in February 2013, is set to pronounce her verdict this week.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL
